meanings.definition: In a way that is limited in extent, amount, or scope.
meanings.sent1: She narrowly avoided the puddle on the sidewalk.
meanings.sent2: The path was so narrow that only one person could walk on it at a time.
meanings.sent3: He narrowly missed stepping on the banana peel and slipping comically.
meanings.sent4: The deadline was approaching narrowly, like a train rushing towards the station.
meanings.sent5: The room was so narrowly packed with furniture that it felt suffocating.

meanings.definition: In a way that is close or limited in distance.
meanings.sent1: The two houses were narrowly spaced, almost touching each other.
meanings.sent2: The car narrowly missed hitting the tree by a few inches.
meanings.sent3: She narrowly made it to the bus stop just before the bus arrived.
meanings.sent4: The cat crept narrowly along the edge of the wall, trying to stay hidden.
meanings.sent5: The friends sat narrowly together on the small bench, sharing a secret.

meanings.definition: In a way that is barely or narrowly successful.
meanings.sent1: He narrowly passed the exam by studying hard the night before.
meanings.sent2: The team narrowly won the game with a last-minute goal.
meanings.sent3: She narrowly made it to the airport in time for her flight.
meanings.sent4: The rope bridge swayed narrowly as they crossed over the deep ravine.
meanings.sent5: The fragile vase narrowly avoided being knocked over by the playful puppy.
